Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to produce a final event log in Markdown table with rows per event, covering all events across all orders, using order_id as case ID. Include at least columns: Case ID, Activity Name, Timestamp, Resource/Actor (optional), Other Attributes (if available). Must map timestamps correctly and ensure chronological order per case.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to infer activities: - Order Created from Orders table (order_date). Possibly also include Customer, Sales Person etc as attributes. - Items Picked events from Order Lines with item_picking_date. Might be multiple events per line? Could create separate events per line with activity Item Picked and resource = picker_id mapped to resource_name and role. - Order Dispatched from Delivery.dispatch_date, with resource maybe carrier? Or could be Dispatch activity with carrier_id. - Order Arrived from Delivery.arrival_date, similar. - Invoice Issued from Invoice invoice_issue_date, with billing_person. - Payment Received from Payments payment_date, with payment_method, reference.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Items Picked: two items. Could have separate events for each line? Or combine? The instruction: If multiple timestamps are available (e.g., item_picking_date for multiple items), produce one event per activity if its meaningful, or summarize if appropriate. We can produce two separate events: one for each item picked (maybe activity Item Picked - ITEM-001 or generic Item(s) Picked with quantity? Could produce separate rows with activity Item Picked and additional attribute item_id. Simpler: produce one event Items Picked with timestamp maybe earliest picking date? But we have two dates: 2024-01-02T10:15 and 2024-01-02T11:00. Could produce two events: Item Picked - ITEM-001 at 10:15, Item Picked - ITEM-002 at 11:00. Resource = picker_id (WH-001 and WH-002). Well include item_id attribute.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Lets construct events per order: Order 1001: - Order Created: timestamp 2024-01-01T09:00:00Z, resource maybe sales_person? Could be sales_person_id SP-001 (Alice Brown) role Sales Person. - Items Picked: two items... Order 1002: - Order Created: 2024-01-02T12:30:00Z, sales_person SP-002 (Bob Smith). - Items Picked: two lines... Deliveries: two delivery records... Order 1003: ... Order 1004: ... Order 1005: ...

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We can include a column Attributes that contains a JSON-like string of relevant attributes. Thus table header: | Case ID | Activity Name | Timestamp | Resource/Actor | Attributes | Well fill rows. We need to ensure chronological order across events? Not necessarily globally, but each orders events should be in chronological order within that case. The table can be sorted by Case ID then Timestamp.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait duplicate? Actually invoice for order 1005 is INV-1005, but we already used INV-1005 for order 1004? Actually INV-1005 is for order 1005, amount 500. So we should not duplicate. For order 1004 we used INV-1005? Wait invoice table: INV-1005 is for order 1005. So order 1004 has no invoice? Actually there is no invoice for order 1004 in the provided invoice table. So we should not create invoice event for order 1004. Good catch. Thus we need to adjust events for order 1004: only Order Created, Item Picked, Delivery Dispatched, Delivery Arrived, maybe Payment? No payment linked to order 1004. So we stop there.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: Case 1004: Order Created - 2024-01-04T14:15:00Z - Charlie Kim - { Sales Person ID: SP-003; Order Priority: Low; Customer Type: Government} Item Picked - ITEM-001 - 2024-01-06T08:00:00Z - Eva Johnson - {Picker ID: WH-002; Quantity: 5; Item ID: ITEM-001} Delivery Dispatched - 2024-01-07T10:15:00Z - FastShip - {Carrier ID: CR-02; Delivery Note: Fragile items, handle with care} Delivery Arrived - 2024-01-09T11:45:00Z - FastShip - {}
